sentences: Chris Knight (born June 24, 1960) is an American singer-songwriter from Slaughters, Kentucky.
In 1986, he heard Steve Earle on the radio and decided to start writing songs.
When Decca Records hired Liddell for an A&R position, Knight received a contract and in 1998 Decca released his self-titled debut.
Knight is well known and because of his particular fame in Texas, was named an "Honorary Texan" in 2006 by Texas Governor Rick Perry.
Called The Trailer Tapes, they were officially released in 2007.
It took Knight four years to release Little Victories in 2012.
In 2015, Chris Knight was featured in Season 1, Episode 2 of CarbonTV's original series, American Elements.
Decca folded at the end of the 1990s, only two years after Knight joined the label.
When he was three years old, he asked for a plastic guitar for Christmas.
He worked for ten years as a mine reclamation inspector and as a miner's consultant for the Kentucky Department of Surface Mining.
After six years he came to Nashville and won a spot on a songwriters' night at the Bluebird Cafe.
After a couple years without a label, Knight signed with Dualtone Music Group.
It took Knight four years to release Little Victories in 2012.
